answers.answer: Inaccurate measurements on one ultrasound or the other, that's the most likely reason.There just isn't enough info here to really say.  Did the ultrasound show any signs of any other problems?Do you have gestational diabetes?The range of weights you've given is not specific enough.  For example, if the baby weighed 4 pounds at 30 weeks and 6 pounds at 33 weeks, that's not too far out of the norm for a weight GAIN (though still a very big baby, certainly).  But if the baby weighed 3 pounds at 30 weeks, and 7 pounds at 33 weeks...something really isn't right about that.What does your doctor say?

well they are supposed to gain about a half pound per weeks so at 30 weeks the baby was 4 lbs then it was supposed to gain 1.5 lbs so that makes 5.5 lbs which is close to your 6 lbs.  It is very possible that this is normal.  Being off by 1 lb can make a huge difference in what you may think is normal or what is not normal.

question: What may be some reasons why a baby would go from weighing 3-4 lbs at 30 weeks to 6-7 lbs at 33 weeks other than diabetes?
title: Babies large weight gain in 2-3 wks
